system.description:
Racial Traits

  • Kobolds are Small sized creatures. They gain  −1 size penalty to all melee attack rolls.
  • Kobolds can not use Colossal or Gargantuan sized weapons, take a −6 attack penalty when using all Huge weapons, take a −2 attack penalty when using all Large sized weapons and take a −1 attack penalty when using all Medium sized weapons.
  • Kobolds can communicate entirely without any kind of verbal communication, through the use of fine, rapid nose twitches.
  • Kobolds possess Darkvision, which allows them to see in total darkness, out to 50 feet. This vision is black-and-white only.

Racial Traits (Active Effect)

  • Kobolds are Small sized creatures. They gain a +1 size bonus to Defense.
  • When calculating the carrying capacity for a kobold, multiply all carrying capacity values by .50. This carrying capacity reduction includes the calculation for small creatures.

Dragons

All dragons have tails that can be targeted. They have the same targeting rules as legs. Any armor that provides protection to legs, will also provide protection to tails.

Physical Description

A healthy kobold typically stands between 3¾-4½’, and weighs between 90-140 lbs. The males are slightly larger than the females. Male and female Kobolds gain large ears as they reach adulthood. Kobolds have thin scales covering their body, which are usually a light green to a dark brown color. Kobolds do not have hair. The average Kobold lifespan is 80 years, reaching physical adulthood between the ages of 14-16.

Language

The native language of a Kobold is Kobalthwyn. They will often speak Trade Bant Simplified.

Names

Kobolds have a rather unique naming system, in which their name constantly changes, due to any changing circumstances, or events that happen with the kobold. The Kobold will have to refer to his old names when reuniting with old friends and acquaintances, to update them. Usually, these names are flattering to the kobold, but some can be less than flattering. Non-kobolds will usually refer to the first name they know the kobold by, to no offense to the kobold.
